dialogues.text: (gets off horse) Lying will cost you your life! The STEWARD snatches the shoe. The WIFE pushes the Stewar and grabs the slipper back. WIFE (DESPERATE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care if this costs me my life...  STEWARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will pay for this! 62

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The C-PRINCE rides in (with the other SLIPPER), followed his RETINUE. The STEWARD takes the opportunity to pull th slipper from the WIFE'S hand as she curtsies. STEWARD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sire! I have succeeded in obtaining the other slipper. He holds it up. The WIFE steps forward. WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please give me the slipper, kind Prince, and all will come to a happy end. STEWARD (OVERLAPPING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Step back, peon! C'S PRINCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do as she says, Steward. We only need one. STEWARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... He hands the slipper back to the WIFE. The STEWARD gets o his horse. WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to C'S PRINCE) Thank you. Thank you! C'S PRINCE (TO STEWARD)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We must search immediately for the maiden who fits this slipper. STEWARD (SURPRISED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight? C'S PRINCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This very night! The PRINCE, STEWARD and RETINUE ride off, leaving the WIF alone. She looks up to the moon and hurries off. We follow the WIFE'S feet as she scurries past the beginn of a BEANSTALK CURLING UPWARDS from the ground.

dialogues.speaker: BAKER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And in her haste, the Baker's Wife took no notice of a second beanstalk climbing skyward. 63

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRUMPETS sound. The C-PRINCE, the STEWARD and the RETINUE ride through the town, as VILLAGERS open their windows an rush out of their houses. STEWARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let it be known that his Royal Highness the Crown Prince will be visiting every house in this village tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CINDERELLA has only just got back. Grubby again, and wear her old clothes, she bundles her beautiful dress into a chest.

dialogues.speaker: STEWARD, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: All young maidens are hereby commanded to remain in their home until they are visited by the Royal Guard. CINDERELLA goes to the window and looks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CINDERELLA'S POV: The C-PRINCE and the royal RETINUE arri in the entry courtyard. BACK ON CINDERELLA. She smiles to herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire STEPFAMILY has assembled, in various stages of undress. LUCINDA stands and watches as the STEPMOTHER tri to force FLORINDA'S large foot into the tiny slipper.

dialogues.speaker: BAKER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: As the Prince anxiously waited, the Stepmother took matters -- and Florinda's foot -- into her own hands. FLORINDA

dialogues.speaker: CAREFUL, MY TOE--
dialogues.text: STEPMOTHER

dialogues.speaker: DARLING, I KNOW--
dialogues.text: FLORINDA

dialogues.speaker: WHAT'LL WE DO
dialogues.text: STEPMOTHER

dialogues.speaker: NEVER NEED TO WALK
dialogues.text: The STEPMOTHER takes a handkerchief and stuffs it into th girl's mouth and then pulls a large kitchen knife from he pocket and raises it over her foot-- 64

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing lanterns have been set up outside the house, bat the area in light. The STEPFAMILY watches as the STEWARD helps FLORINDA up o the back of the Prince's horse. In pain, she grits her te in a frozen smile.

dialogues.speaker: BAKER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Minus one toe, Florinda mounted the Prince's horse, unaware of the blood dripping from the slipper. As the STEWARD steps back, he notices a tiny speck of blo on his white glove. He looks up to the PRINCE to show him hand. The PRINCE looks back to FLORINDA who shrugs sheepishly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This time the STEPMOTHER tries to force LUCINDA'S foot in the slipper. FLORINDA looks on with a smirk.

dialogues.speaker: BAKER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Lucinda was next. LUCINDA

dialogues.speaker: WHY WON'T IT FIT
dialogues.text: STEPMOTHER

dialogues.speaker: OF THE HEEL AND IT WILL./
dialogues.text: (she pulls out knife)

dialogues.speaker: WALK
dialogues.text: QUICK SHOTS:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLORINDA'S hand over LUCINDA'S mouth. The KNIFE raised up by the mother. LUCINDA'S eyes in fear as we hear a muffled scream and th "WOOSH" of a knife--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PRINCE and STEWARD wait impatiently in the torchlight

dialogues.speaker: BAKER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Minus a heel, Lucinda did her best to swallow the pain. At last, LUCINDA appears, masking her pain with a smile, limps towards the PRINCE. She is followed by her MOTHER a SISTER. 65  STEPMOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a perfect fit, Your Highness! LUCINDA winks at the PRINCE flirtatiously, then promptly faints to the ground with a thud. The shoe falls from her foot. The PRINCE nods to the STEWARD who walks over and gingerly picks up the bloody slipper. C'S PRINCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you no other daughters? STEPMOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only a little stunted kitchen wench, which her late father left behind but she cannot present herself. She is too dirty. Out of the shadows, CINDERELLA appears. The STEWARD hands the slipper to the Prince, who kneels d in front of CINDERELLA and easily slips it on her foot. C'S PRINCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would recognize these beautiful eyes anywhere. This is the true bride! The PRINCE sweeps CINDERELLA off her feet and leads her t his horse. The two of them ride off. FLORINDA and LUCINDA watch, not at all happy. Then they h a CAWING (the sound of birds) overhead. They look up, alarmed. BIRD'S POV. Far below, FLORINDA and LUCINDA cower togethe dreading what is to come as the CAMERA rushes towards the

dialogues.speaker: BAKER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: As punishment for their cruelty, Cinderella's birds swooped down upon the Stepsisters... and blinded them. The BIRDS enter the picture frame, more and more, their CAWING rising to a crescendo until their flapping wings a all we see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAPUNZEL is alone in a mossy bower on an isolated island the middle of swamp waters filled with POISONOUS SNAKES. hums a sad refrain.

dialogues.speaker: BAKER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: As for Rapunzel, the Witch had banished her to a swamp in the darkest depths of the forest. ANOTHER ANGLE. The R-PRINCE with a ragged scarf wrapped around his now blinded eyes, sits slumped over on his hor as the animal navigates its way through the marshy expans The R-PRINCE lifts his head as he hears RAPUNZEL'S singin 66

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could it be? The horse, seemingly knowing the way, follow the sound as the R-PRINCE calls her name. R'S PRINCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rapunzel? Rapunzel?

dialogues.speaker: RAPUNZEL
dialogues.text: She looks up and cries with delight when she sees her PRI across the water. RAPUNZEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My darling! She jumps into the swamp, fearlessly ignoring the SNAKES, until she reaches terra firma and her man. R-PRINCE falls from his horse onto the ground. R'S PRINCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rapunzel? Is it you? RAPUNZEL reaches him and rips off his scarf. She kneels t cradle his face, weeping. RAPUNZEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could she do this to you? EXTREME CLOSE-UP: RAPUNZEL'S TEAR falls into the R-PRINCE blind eye. The PRINCE'S vision is restored. R'S PRINCE (ASTONISHED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rapunzel! RAPUNZEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? R'S PRINCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see you! The two of them embrace. At the same time, we hear MOOING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BAKER is pulling a very obstinate WHITE COW through t woods. He looks up at the MOON which is almost completely covered in SHADOW. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the COW) Come on! We don't have any time... Then the WIFE rushes in from another direction, carrying SLIPPER. 67  WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've found you! (sees the cow) You've got the cow! BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got the slipper! WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've all four! They hug with delight but are quickly startled by the WIT who appears in the hollow of a tree. WITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see a cow. I see a slipper. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the cape as red as blood. WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the hair as yellow as corn. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've done it! WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got them all. But suddenly the WITCH is suspicious. WITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute! (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That cow doesn't look as white as milk to me. WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course she is. A desperate glance at the BAKER. He couldn't have screwed this up -- could he? WIFE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has to be! The WITCH walks over and smacks the animal. Flour puffs o its back. WITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This cow has been covered with flour! WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To the BAKER) What? You didn't get a real white cow? The BAKER turns to the WITCH. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had a cow as white as milk. Honestly we did. 68  WITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then where is she? WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's dead. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we thought you'd prefer a live cow. WITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I'd prefer a live cow! So show me the dead cow and I'll bring her back to life!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK'S MOTHER is madly hurrying through the woods, search for JACK. She hears HARP MUSIC -- and that carries her to JACK, sitting with his harp next to the mound where MILKY-WHITE has been covered with LEAVES. JACK'S MOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack! There you are! I've been worried sick about you! There's a dead giant in our backyard! JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is? JACK'S MOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know there is. You could have been crushed! JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Mother, look. The most beautiful harp. JACK'S MOTHER (CONFLICTED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've stolen too much. She cuffs the back of his head... then hugs him.

dialogues.speaker: JACK'S MOTHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You could have been killed coming down that plant. The WITCH, the BAKER and the WIFE hurry towards the leafy mound. WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're running out of time! BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's here... JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening? 69  BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's going to bring Milky-White back to life. JACK (AMAZED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can do that? BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a witch! She can do anything! JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow! WITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stand back! They quickly move away, and the WITCH invokes some unintelligible incantation, and with the wave of her cape the DEAD COW comes back to life, shaking off the leaves. JACK races over to her. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milky-White. You're back! I missed you so much! The BAKER looks up at the MOON...only a slither left, the rest covered by SHADOW. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's almost midnight! WITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet! Feed the objects to the cow. WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? WITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard me! Feed them to the cow! The WIFE and BAKER walk towards the COW and begin feeding a portion of the ingredients. Not an easy chew for the animal. The WITCH hands them a silver chalice. WITCH (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fill this! JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do it. She'll only milk for me. JACK begins milking the cow, the others watching intently but alas, nothing is coming out. JACK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Squeeze, pal! You can do it. 70

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tries harder to no avail. The WITCH goes over and look into the goblet. Nothing. WITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrong ingredients. Forget about a child! WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! We followed your instructions. One, the cow is as white as milk. Correct? WITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And two, the cape was certainly as red as blood. WITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And three, the slipper-- WITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And four, I compared the hair with this ear of corn. WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I pulled it from a maiden in a tower AND-- WITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You what?! What were you doing there? WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, nothing. I happened to be PASSING BY-- WITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I touched that hair! I told you! I cannot have touched the ingredients! BAKER/WIFE (MOANING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nooooo... JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The corn! The corn! BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? JACK grabs the ear of corn out of the BAKER'S hand. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can use the silky hair of the corn-- 71  WITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! Pull it from the ear and feed it to the cow. Quickly! The BAKER grabs the ear of corn from JACK, pulls the hair from the corn and feeds it to the cow. JACK begins milking the cow again. We hear the distant CH OF MIDNIGHT begin. Light pours from above bathing them in a growing haze of LIGHT as the SHADOW finally eclipses the MOON. The COW le out a BLOODCURDLING MOAN. WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's working! JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's milking! The WITCH grabs the chalice. WITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At last! The WITCH drinks the potion. She begins to shake. Blue sm begins to pour from her and swirl about as if she is trap inside a cloud. The WIFE lets out a shriek.. The BAKER looks at his WIFE, her belly begins to grow to months-full of pregnancy. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was quick! The cloud that has surrounded the WITCH now engulfs the a until a brisk wind blows it away, revealing a beautiful w standing in the BLUE LIGHT of the FULL MOON. The WITCH ha been restored to her former self, and she likes what she sees. The final CHIME OF MIDNIGHT is joined by every other BELL THE KINGDOM -- a joyous cacophony as we: CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GOLDEN ROSE PETALS fill the air, swirling across the scre PULLING BACK we see that the petals are being thrown by CHEERING SUBJECTS who toss more into the air as they clam to catch a glimpse of CINDERELLA and her PRINCE on their wedding day. MUSIC. CINDERELLA'S carriage resplendent in gold drawn by black stallions passes. She sits demurely smiling as her PRINCE plays to the PASSERS-BY. This comes easily to him. 72

dialogues.speaker: BAKER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And it came to pass, all that seemed wrong was now right. The Witch succeeded in reversing her mother's curse. Cinderella finally stopped running from her Prince. CINDERELLA'S POV on the crowd. She sees JACK and his MOTHER waving; JACK'S MOTHER is ove dressed in brand new clothes including a ridiculous "fascinator" hat.

dialogues.speaker: BAKER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Jack was reunited with his beloved cow and his mother could now dress in the best a golden egg could buy. Cinderella now sees the BAKER and his WIFE standing among the crowd, the WIFE holding their new BABY BOY.

dialogues.speaker: BAKER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And the Baker and his Wife were proud parents of a strapping baby boy. The WIFE shows her the BABY. WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling to her) Thanks for the slipper. The carriage arrives at the entrance to the castle. As th PRINCE and CINDERELLA step from their carriage they are m by cheers. The STEPFAMILY awaits the married couple. The beaming STEPMOTHER with her DAUGHTERS who are now wearing dark glasses, holding canes and looking rather glum. RAPUNZEL stands with her PRINCE. The CROWD ROARS as CINDERELLA and her PRINCE wave. The STEWARD takes up a large speaking trumpet and the CRO quiets. STEWARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let us cheer the newlyweds as they embark on their happy bliss today, and EVER AFTER--

dialogues.speaker: BAKER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And so with the kingdom filled with joy, those who deserved to were destined to live happily ever... 73

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the earth SHAKES with a mighty force, tossing CINDERELLA and her PRINCE (mid-kiss), along with their ATTENDANTS and the entire CROWD to the ground. A piece of CASTLE comes CRASHING DOWN. Chaos ensues. JACK'S MOTHER stands up and looks around. No sign of JACK JACK'S MOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack? Jack...? ANGLE ON BAKER and his WIFE. BAKER (STUNNED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you alright? WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the baby? WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, he's fine. There is another AFTERSHOCK. ANGLE ON RAPUNZEL. She is spooked by the commotion and ru off through the crowd and disappears. STEWARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (speaking into the HORN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attention! Attention! Let there be no panic. NO PANIC! The Royal Prince wishes to address his loyal subjects. Attention! The R-PRINCE searches the crowd for RAPUNZEL. Those who haven't fled, quiet and gather around. The C-PRINCE takes horn. C'S PRINCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no need for worry. It was an earthquake in a far-off quadrant of our kingdom. Nothing to fear at all. As many of you know, we had another little shaker just days ago. I will personally investigate the disturbance. Now everyone, back to your villages, and on with your lives!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dense mist settles across the kingdom. In the distance beanstalk stretches up to the sky. C'S PRINCE and his RET gallop away from the destroyed castle into the woods. 74

dialogues.speaker: BAKER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But as they made their way back into the woods, their familiar paths were nowhere to be found and their lives were about to take an unexpected turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BAKER and his WIFE are walking down a path -- or the remnants of a path. WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happened? Everything's so different. They discover LRRH sitting on her suitcase in what was on lush area, now trampled and broken. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, little one. Are you alright? What are you doing here? With a suitcase? LRRH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm moving in with Granny. Our whole village collapsed. I couldn't find my mother anywhere. And now I can't find my Granny's cottage. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? LRRH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I went down the dell, and I didn't recognize anything. There was no path. (getting worked up) Where's the stream? Where's the bridge? Where's Granny? WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can help you find Granny's without the path. WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. The WIFE is exhausted. She hands the BABY to the BAKER. WIFE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please take him for a few moments. The BAKER is clearly uncomfortable holding the BABY. They continue walking. The BABY begins to cry. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why does he always cry when I hold him? 75  WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You needn't hold him as if he was so fragile. The BABY wails. The BAKER hands the bundle back. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't want me. He wants his mother! WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't take care of him all of the time. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take care of him -- when he's older... They hear COMMOTION in the distance. WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who might that be? BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the Steward and the royal family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through a thick haze, the BAKER sees the STEWARD, the STEPFAMILY and a few SERVANTS carrying trunks and tending the blind, hobbling STEPSISTERS. The BAKER makes his way to them with his WIFE and LRRH in tow. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What brings you into the woods? STEWARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The castle has been destroyed. WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! STEPMOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kingdom is under attack. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is the Royal family going to do? STEWARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea! I don't make policy. I just carry it out. WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the Baker) I think it best we get back to the village. We'll take the girl with us. She holds out a hand for LRRH. 76  WIFE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You come with us. LRRH takes her hand. But then the ground begins to shake. A frightening and increasingly loud crunching noise. They fight for their footing. The STEPFAMILY drop their belongings and rush to each oth The BAKER puts his arm around his WIFE. Everyone's faces fill with terror as a huge shadow engulf them. WIFE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a giant! BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A giant woman! Through the trees we see the furious face of a female GIA We never see her in her entirety -- but the volume of her voice matches her size. GIANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is the lad who killed my husband? STEWARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no lad here! BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We haven't seen him. The WITCH, who has slipped in behind the group, comes for startling everyone and moves directly to the GIANT. WITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll get him for you right away. Don't move! LRRH races past the WITCH and brandishes her knife. LRRH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was you who destroyed our house - not an earthquake. GIANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And who destroyed my house? I want him! A great bellow that makes the trees shake. The WITCH moves towards the STEPSISTERS. WITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like a blind girl instead? 77

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLORINDA and LUCINDA scream. The STEPMOTHER takes them in embrace. STEPMOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How dare you? She wants the boy! And then JACK'S MOTHER arrives. Innocently, she asks the worst question possible. JACK'S MOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack! Has anyone seen my Jack? He ran off again and I've been... Everyone stares at her. JACK'S MOTHER does a slow take looking up and discovering the GIANT. STEWARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (meaning the GIANT) She's looking for him too. GIANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give him to me! The GIANT suddenly reaches down. They all quickly duck ou the way. JACK'S MOTHER runs forward to confront the GIANT. JACK'S MOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is just a lad! We had no food to eat so he sold his beloved cow in exchange for magic beans. GIANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy - I want the boy! JACK'S MOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You leave my boy alone! GIANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're making me very angry! The GIANT stomps her foot in anger. GIANT (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm waiting! They all lose their balance. The STEWARD uses his staff t hold JACK'S MOTHER back, trying to silence her. STEWARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't make her angry, woman, or you'll get us all killed! But JACK'S MOTHER is in full flow, facing up to the GIANT 78  JACK'S MOTHER (LOSING CONTROL)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flouncing through our kingdom with your great big clodhopppers, destroying everything in your path. STEWARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop! BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't upset the Giant! JACK'S MOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You big bully! I'll hide my son and you'll never find him. You'll never, ever... STEWARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get back woman! The STEWARD forcefully pulls JACK'S MOTHER behind him. Sh trips and falls. STEWARD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the GIANT) The boy is hiding in the steeple tower. You can find him there. STEPMOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, that's true. FLORINDA LUCINDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. The steeple tower. We saw him there!  GIANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he is not, I will return tonight and find you! All of you! The GIANT takes off, the power of her footsteps forcing everyone to hold on to one another for safety. The BAKER'S WIFE sees JACK'S MOTHER, who is still lying o the ground. She goes to her. WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look! What have you done to her? STEWARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't mean to hurt her. I was just thinking of the greater good. The BAKER steps forward, taking charge. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen everyone. If we're going to get through this we have to stick together. 79  STEPMOTHER (SINCERE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some people are cut out to battle giants, and others are not. I don't have the constitution. And as long as I can be of no help, I'm going to hide. (to her retinue) Let's go! (she turns back) Everything will work out fine in the end. WITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not always. The STEPFAMILY leaves. WITCH (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know where they think they're going. The giant's already destroyed the entire village. Only thing left of my garden are these beans. LRRH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we going to do now? WITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have no choice. Find the boy and give her what she wants. LRRH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if we do, she'll kill Jack. WITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if we don't she'll kill half the kingdom! She rushes back into the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK'S MOTHER stirs and sits up. JACK'S MOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promise me you won't let them get Jack. Promise! BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We follow the WITCH as she makes her way in search of RAPUNZEL. She comes to their tower, now fallen. Sitting u a pile of rubble, a bereft RAPUNZEL clutches her cape as cries. WITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rapunzel! You're safe! Thank goodness. 80  RAPUNZEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you? WITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surely you remember? (PLEASED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course you don't recognize me! RAPUNZEL (STUNNED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother? WITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is who I truly am, my dear. Now you don't have to be embarrassed by me. You must come with me. There's a Giant in the land. She moves towards RAPUNZEL -- but suddenly the R-PRINCE r up on his white steed. He jumps off and rushes to RAPUNZE R'S PRINCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My darling. Are you all right? Why did you run off? RAPUNZEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was afraid. R-PRINCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never have to be afraid. Now come with me. WITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not going with you! (TO RAPUNZEL)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will come with me. RAPUNZEL pulls away and turns on the WITCH. RAPUNZEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will not come with you! WITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you leave me no choice. The WITCH pulls RAPUNZEL behind her and tries to cast a s on R'S PRINCE. Nothing. She tries again. Still nothing. The PRINCE takes notice of the Witch. R'S PRINCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You! The one who blinded me. RAPUNZEL (ACCUSING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And locked me in a tower. 81  WITCH (SWEETLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To protect you. RAPUNZEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and then banished me to an island -- in the middle of a swamp! WITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just trying to be a good mother! R'S PRINCE (URGING HER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rapunzel... RAPUNZEL takes one look at her MOTHER then moves to the PRINCE. WITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rapunzel, no! You will never be safe with him. RAPUNZEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take me away from here. R-PRINCE pulls RAPUNZEL up onto his horse. WITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Rapunzel! RAPUNZEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you understand? I never want to see you again. Ever! ANGLE ON THE WITCH watching RAPUNZEL ride into the woods. WITCH (TO HERSELF)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At first, we just see TREES.

dialogues.speaker: BAKER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Jack! Jack!

dialogues.speaker: LRRH, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Jack! Then the BAKER, the BAKER'S WIFE and LRRH appear, still looking for JACK. They come to a halt. 82  BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're never going to find him. WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should fan out. It'll increase our chances. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You can't be on your own. WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be all right. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if we get lost? WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll count our steps from right here. LRRH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go, too. WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You stay with the baby. The WIFE hands LRRH the baby and sits her down. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulling her aside) You would leave our son with her? WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. He's asleep. He'll be safe with the girl. LRRH (ASSUMING MATURITY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am very capable of caring for the baby. WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See? BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what if the Giant comes back... WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if, what if! Five hundred paces. Go! The WIFE turns and starts walking. WIFE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One, two... The BAKER stops her. He unties his SCARF. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! Take this. It might be cold. 83

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BAKER wraps his scarf around her neck and looks at he reluctant to let her go alone. The WIFE turns away and begins to count her steps as she walks off. The BAKER goes off in the opposite direction. WIFE/BAKER (OVERLAPPING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One...two...three...four...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PRINCE is watering his horse in a GIANT footprint. Th WIFE enters counting. WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One eighty-one...one eighty-two... one eighty-three... one eighty-four... (looks up; startled; (BOWS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Your Royal Highness. C'S PRINCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must be here to slay the Giant. C'S PRINCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Giant? WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Surely you've heard there is a giant in our midst. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not an earthquake... C'S PRINCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. A giant. WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it's a lady giant. Unusual, huh? C'S PRINCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should think. And why are you alone in the woods? WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came with my husband. We were ... well you see ... it's a long story. C'S PRINCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He would let you roam alone in the woods? WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, actually it was my choice. C'S PRINCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How brave. 84  WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brave? C'S PRINCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes./ ANYTHING CAN HAPPEN IN THE

dialogues.speaker: COULD BE CRUSHED.
dialogues.text: WIFE UH-- C'S PRINCE

dialogues.speaker: DON'T FEEL RUSHED.
dialogues.text: He kisses her. She succumbs for a moment, then pulls away WIFE

dialogues.speaker: HERE
dialogues.text: He goes in for another kiss and she pulls away once more. WIFE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait one moment, please! We can't do this! You have a Princess! C'S PRINCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, yes, I do. WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I have a...baker. C'S PRINCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, you're right. How foolish./

dialogues.speaker: SKIES MAY FALL/ ANY MOMENT.
dialogues.text: He kisses her again. WIFE (STEPPING BACK)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But this is not right! C'S PRINCE

dialogues.speaker: MOMENT.
dialogues.text: As the PRINCE takes her into his arms, we PAN UP to see CINDERELLA'S BIRDS in the branches looking down at them. 85

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We TRACK with the BAKER before he comes upon CINDERELLA crying at what's left of her MOTHER'S GRAVESTONE and tree BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four eighty two... four eighty three... (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, ma'am. Have you seen a boy... (notices she is CRYING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, may I be of some service? She looks to the BAKER and immediately turns her head for fear she will be recognized. CINDERELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tree has fallen. Mother's grave, destroyed. BAKER (CONFUSED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. I'm sorry. CINDERELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shouldn't complain. I'm sure others have suffered worse after the earthquake. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earthquake? It's no earthquake -- there's a giant terrorizing the kingdom! CINDERELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm sure the Prince will see to it that the Giant is rid from our land. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hah, the Prince? No doubt he's off somewhere seducing some young maiden. CINDERELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (She turns to him) What? BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look just like the Princess -- but dirty. Oh no, you are the Princess! He drops to his knees and bows. CINDERELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. Please... Get up! I'm not a princess here. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I didn't recognize you. 86  CINDERELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to disguise myself. I'm not permitted to leave the palace unescorted. CINDERELLA looks away towards the wreckage of her mother' grave. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you'd like you can come with me. You will be safe in our company. CINDERELLA thinks for a moment, then nods. CINDERELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The C-PRINCE is wrapped in an embrace with the WIFE. He suddenly breaks away. C'S PRINCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must leave you. She looks at him confused. He walks over to his horse and mounts it.

dialogues.speaker: C'S PRINCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now I must go off to slay a giant. I shall not forget you. How brave you are to be alone in the woods. And how alive you've made me feel. And just like that, he rides off leaving a cloud of dust his wake. WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that?/ WAS THAT ME?/ WAS THAT

dialogues.speaker: SHOULDS.
dialogues.text: (she stops for a MOMENT) (MORE) 87  WIFE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: NEVER
dialogues.text: She begins retracing her steps. WIFE (CONT'D) (SHE CONTINUES)

dialogues.speaker: THE WOODS.
dialogues.text: She stops to catch her breath and make sure she's on the right path. WIFE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: NEVER KNOW YOU HAD ONE.
dialogues.text: (on the move again)

dialogues.speaker: FOR A MOMENT, THOUGH./
dialogues.text: The WIFE looks in the direction of where the C-PRINCE exi WIFE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: WHEN YOU'RE BACK TO "OR"/
dialogues.text: She looks down to the BAKER'S scarf and pulls it from her waist. WIFE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: TIME TO LEAVE THE WOODS
dialogues.text: With newfound determination to return to her husband, she ties the scarf around her neck and begins to trace her st BACK: WIFE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One eighty-four... one eighty-three... one eighty-two... 88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops. An ominous expression crosses her face. We beg to hear the pounding steps of the GIANT moving closer. Th WIFE scrambles up a steep incline trying to find a way to out of the GIANT'S path. She makes it to the top, but realizes there is no way down on the other side. As the GIANT'S footsteps near, the WIFE is engulfed in darkness. Trees begin to fall around her and as the earth shakes, she loses her balance and falls backwards with a scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BAKER is pacing back and forth. CINDERELLA is tending the BABY. LRRH sits staring sadly into space. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She should be back by now. LRRH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wouldn't get lost. CINDERELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure she'll return. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I must go and look for her-- They hear a commotion. It's the WITCH, who has JACK by th scruff of the neck. WITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look who I found! JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're hurting me! The WITCH continues pulling the boy along. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go of him! WITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll let go of him when I give him to the Giant. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make her stop! LRRH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave him alone! LRRH goes to try and pull JACK away from the WITCH. A tus ensues, and the BAKER notices that JACK has dropped something. He goes over and picks up his SCARF. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at the top of his LUNGS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop! I said stop! 89

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They do. The BAKER moves to JACK. BAKER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you find this? The WITCH releases JACK. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, sir... BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my wife's! JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I came upon her. She was at the bottom of a cliff... BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you saying? JACK can't say the words. CINDERELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How awful... BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No...! As the truth sinks in. BAKER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my fault. I let her wander off alone. I should have made her stay with me. WITCH (IMPATIENT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remorse will get you nowhere. BAKER (ANGRY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My wife is dead! WITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake up! When you're dead, you're dead. (goes after JACK) Now it's time to get this boy to the Giant before we're all-- CINDERELLA and LRRH block her way. CINDERELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep away from him. LRRH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! 90  WITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is no time to be soft-hearted! He's going to the Giant and I'm taking him. The BAKER grabs hold of JACK. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! He's the one to blame! It's because of you there's a giant in our midst and my wife is dead! JACK

dialogues.speaker: THE FIRST PLACE
dialogues.text: This becomes one big game of "tag", the group reconstitut itself as they gang up on whomever they think is the guil party. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: PERSUADED YOU/ TO STEAL THAT GOLD
dialogues.text: LRRH (TO JACK)

dialogues.speaker: SEE, IT'S YOUR FAULT.
dialogues.text: JACK

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: BAKER

dialogues.speaker: YES, IT'S YOUR FAULT.
dialogues.text: JACK

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: LRRH

dialogues.speaker: YES, IT IS
dialogues.text: JACK

dialogues.speaker: IT'S NOT
dialogues.text: BAKER

dialogues.speaker: IT'S TRUE.
dialogues.text: JACK

dialogues.speaker: FROM YOU
dialogues.text: They turn on the BAKER. 91  LRRH

dialogues.speaker: SO IT'S YOUR FAULT
dialogues.text: JACK

dialogues.speaker: YES
dialogues.text: BAKER

dialogues.speaker: REVERSED
dialogues.text: They march over to the WITCH who stands firm. WITCH

dialogues.speaker: CURSED/ IN THE FIRST PLACE
dialogues.text: LRRH

dialogues.speaker: OH./ THEN IT'S HIS FAULT
dialogues.text: WITCH

dialogues.speaker: SO.
dialogues.text: CINDERELLA

dialogues.speaker: IT WAS HIS FAULT.
dialogues.text: JACK

dialogues.speaker: NO.
dialogues.text: BAKER

dialogues.speaker: YES, IT IS,/ IT'S HIS.
dialogues.text: CINDERELLA

dialogues.speaker: I GUESS...
dialogues.text: JACK (TO CINDERELLA)

dialogues.speaker: FIRST PLACE
dialogues.text: CINDERELLA

dialogues.speaker: YES
dialogues.text: LRRH

dialogues.speaker: HOW
dialogues.text: BAKER

dialogues.speaker: HMM...
dialogues.text: JACK

dialogues.speaker: WELL,/ WHO HAD THE OTHER BEAN
dialogues.text: BAKER

dialogues.speaker: THE OTHER BEAN
dialogues.text: 92  CINDERELLA

dialogues.speaker: THE OTHER BEAN
dialogues.text: JACK

dialogues.speaker: YOU POCKETED THE OTHER BEAN.
dialogues.text: BAKER

dialogues.speaker: I DIDN'T
dialogues.text: LRRH

dialogues.speaker: SO IT'S YOUR FAULT--
dialogues.text: BAKER

dialogues.speaker: WIFE
dialogues.text: LRRH

dialogues.speaker: SO IT'S HER FAULT--
dialogues.text: BAKER

dialogues.speaker: NO, IT ISN'T
dialogues.text: CINDERELLA

dialogues.speaker: THEN WHOSE IS IT
dialogues.text: BAKER (TO CINDERELLA)

dialogues.speaker: IS YOU
dialogues.text: Moving on CINDERELLA. CINDERELLA

dialogues.speaker: SO I THREW--/ WELL, DON'T LOOK HERE
dialogues.text: LRRH

dialogues.speaker: SO IT'S YOUR FAULT
dialogues.text: CINDERELLA BUT-- JACK

dialogues.speaker: SEE, IT'S HER FAULT--
dialogues.text: CINDERELLA BUT-- JACK

dialogues.speaker: AND IT ISN'T MINE AT ALL
dialogues.text: BAKER (TO CINDERELLA)

dialogues.speaker: BUT WHAT
dialogues.text: 93  CINDERELLA (TO JACK)

dialogues.speaker: WELL, IF YOU HADN'T GONE/ BACK UP
dialogues.text: AGAIN-- JACK

dialogues.speaker: WE WERE NEEDY--
dialogues.text: CINDERELLA

dialogues.speaker: HEN
dialogues.text: JACK

dialogues.speaker: BUT I GOT IT FOR MY MOTHER--
dialogues.text: LRRH

dialogues.speaker: SO IT'S HER FAULT THEN
dialogues.text: CINDERELLA

dialogues.speaker: THIRD PLACE
dialogues.text: BAKER

dialogues.speaker: THE HARP--YES
dialogues.text: They turn on LRRH. JACK

dialogues.speaker: SHE WENT AND DARED ME TO
dialogues.text: LRRH

dialogues.speaker: I DARED YOU TO
dialogues.text: JACK

dialogues.speaker: YOU DARED ME TO
dialogues.text: SCARED-- LRRH

dialogues.speaker: ME
dialogues.text: JACK

dialogues.speaker: --TO./ SHE DARED ME
dialogues.text: LRRH

dialogues.speaker: SO IT'S YOUR FAULT
dialogues.text: LRRH

dialogues.speaker: WAIT A MINUTE--
dialogues.text: Every man for himself because there's enough blame to go around. 94  CINDERELLA BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to LRRH) (to JACK)

dialogues.speaker: THE FIRST PLACE
dialogues.text: CINDERELLA LRRH (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points to the WITCH) (TO CINDERELLA)

dialogues.speaker: PLACE--
dialogues.text: JACK

dialogues.speaker: FIRST PLACE--
dialogues.text: They turn to the WITCH who has her back to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: CINDERELLA/JACK/LRRH/BAKER
dialogues.text: (charging the WITCH)

dialogues.speaker: BLAME
dialogues.text: The WITCH turns on them. She is holding the BAKER'S BABY her arms. WITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhhhhhh!

dialogues.speaker: DOESN'T MATTER NOW.
dialogues.text: She thrusts the BABY into the BAKER'S arms. WITCH (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: TRUE
dialogues.text: She lunges for JACK, but LRRH and CINDERELLA put themselv in her path. 95  WITCH (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: ME THE BOY.
dialogues.text: LRRH/CINDERELLA

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: WITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No?/ YOU'RE SO NICE./ YOU'RE NOT

dialogues.speaker: BOTHER
dialogues.text: (OMINOUS)

dialogues.speaker: SOON YOU'LL SEE THE SKY FALL.
dialogues.text: She pulls out some BEANS from her satchel and THROWS them the ground where they flash upon impact. She knows that losing the beans will be her end. The OTHERS scramble to them up. WITCH (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: GLOOM/ AND THE DOOM/ AND THE BOOM/
dialogues.text: The ground swells beneath her lifting her upwards. Then suddenly, the earth deflates into a sinkhole that sucks t WITCH to its core, swallowing her up as she lets out her final cry. WITCH (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four back up and scatter for safety as a lava-like substance oozes from where the Witch disappeared, creatin large TAR PIT. As the smoke lifts, the four come together shaken. The BAKER holds the BABY. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I shouldn't have stolen from the Giant... LRRH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I shouldn't have strayed from the path... CINDERELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I shouldn't have attended the Ball... BAKER (BITTER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Maybe you shouldn't have... He hands CINDERELLA the BABY and turns to leave. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going? BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Away from here. LRRH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you said we had to find our way out of this together. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter whether we're together or apart. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need your help. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't understand. My wife was the one who helped. I depended on her for everything. CINDERELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You would leave your child? BAKER (DESPONDENT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll be happier in the arms of a Princess... He begins to walk off. CINDERELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But wait...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BAKER walks aimlessly through the woods alone. 97

dialogues.speaker: BAKER'S FATHER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Son. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BAKER turns. His FATHER -- the father he remembers as child -- follows close behind. He wears the identical hun jacket. BAKER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to talk to you. It's because of you all of this happened. Go away! BAKER'S FATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I did a foolish thing. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would you do that? Why did you take the Witch's beans? BAKER'S FATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were there and I wanted them. I didn't think. I was being careless -- BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Selfish. BAKER'S FATHER YES -- BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stole them and you were caught, and then you did what you do. You just ran away. BAKER'S FATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When your mother died, I was... I hated myself and I ran from my guilt and my shame... BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and your son. BAKER'S FATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, and my son. And I'm sorry for that. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're looking for forgiveness, you're not going to get it. BAKER'S FATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never expected... BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what do you want? 98  BAKER'S FATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you making the same mistake? The BAKER says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: BAKER'S FATHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Aren't you running away? (the Baker looks AWAY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be better than me, son. Do better... The BAKER turns to look at his FATHER, but he is gone. Wa ever there? The BAKER walks angrily along an overgrown path through t woods. He slows, sits down on a tree stump and breaks dow his wife's scarf in his hands. Slowly he calms himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK and LRRH are making a plan. CINDERELLA has the BABY. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If there were just some way we could surprise the Giant. LRRH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's too tall to surprise. They look up as a newly determined BAKER returns. CINDERELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew you wouldn't give up. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wouldn't leave his baby. LRRH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looked like he was going to. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me my son. The BAKER takes the BABY. The baby begins to cry. BAKER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulling the baby close to comfort HIM)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, hey. LRRH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we going to do now? BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to rid this kingdom of the Giant -- together. (MORE) 99  BAKER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll be back soon; here's the plan. We're going to feed Jack to the Giant.  JACK CINDERELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? No!  BAKER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to use you as bait to lure the Giant towards the tar pit. Suddenly a swarm of BIRDS appears overhead. CINDERELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The birds can help! (TO BIRDS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh good friends we need your help more than ever. (BIRDS CHIRP)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What of the prince? She looks to the BAKER awkwardly. Then resolute... CINDERELLA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That doesn't matter now! What's important is that we find a way to defeat the Giant. (BIRDS CHIRP)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes, thank you birds. The BIRDS fly off. The others look at her with amazement. LRRH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can talk to birds? CINDERELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The birds will do their part. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, we don't have much time. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm excited. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's what we're going to do... The BAKER leads them away from the tar pit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CINDERELLA settles the baby. CINDERELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father's being very brave. We're going to be very brave too. The C-PRINCE is passing a nearby path on horseback. He st when he sees CINDERELLA. 100  C'S PRINCE (CALLING OVER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you alright, miss? CINDERELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hiding her face) The Giant went in that direction. He rides closer. C'S PRINCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My darling! (DISMOUNTS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did not recognize you. What are you doing here? And with a child? You must go back to the castle at once. There's a giant on the loose. CINDERELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm well aware of that. He comes and puts his arm around her, but she pulls away. C'S PRINCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My love. What is it? CINDERELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I'm not your only love. C'S PRINCE (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you. Truly I do.  CINDERELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you love me, why did you stray? C'S PRINCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought if you were mine, that I would never wish for more. CINDERELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If this is how you behave as a prince, what kind of king will you be? C'S PRINCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was raised to be charming, not sincere. CINDERELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you should go. C'S PRINCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going to leave you. CINDERELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Consider that I've been lost. A victim of the Giant. C'S PRINCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what you really wish? 101  CINDERELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father's house was a nightmare. Your house was a dream. Now I want something in-between. She takes off her wedding ring and gives it back to him. stands there for a moment, then mounts his horse. C'S PRINCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shall always love the maiden who ran away. CINDERELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I the faraway prince. The PRINCE rides off. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: A TREE BY THE TAR PIT
dialogues.text: The BAKER is scaling his way up the tall tree. JACK follo him, each carrying slings and stones. A branch gives way under JACK but he is able to keep his balance. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Careful, there. Not so fast. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You needn't worry -- this is easier than a beanstalk. ANGLE ON CINDERELLA. She's sitting on a tree stump, rocki the baby. LRRH returns. LRRH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're in the tree -- over there. We made slings out of my cape. LRRH sits next to CINDERELLA. LRRH (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to climb too. CINDERELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad you're here to help me. LRRH turns her head away. CINDERELLA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong? LRRH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think my mother and my Granny would be upset with me. CINDERELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? 102  LRRH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They said always to make them proud and here I am about to kill somebody. CINDERELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not somebody. A giant who's done a lot of harm. LRRH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But a giant's a person. Aren't we to show forgiveness? CINDERELLA

dialogues.speaker: ALONE, TRULY./ NO ONE IS ALONE.
dialogues.text: LRRH

dialogues.speaker: I WISH...
dialogues.text: CINDERELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: The BAKER and JACK position themselves on a limb within t tree. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait until my mother hears I've slain the Giant. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, there's something you have to know. Your mother... JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't make it. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was she killed by the Giant? BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It wasn't like that. She was fighting with the Giant, trying to protect you, and she was pushed by the Steward -- and -- she fell. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Steward will pay for this. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Jack -- JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After we slay the Giant, I will slay him. 103  BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll do nothing of the kind. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What he done was wrong. He should be punished. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not as easy as that. CUT BACK AND FORTH. CINDERELLA (TO LRRH)

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER ISN'T HERE NOW.
dialogues.text: BAKER (TO JACK; CONCILIATORY)

dialogues.speaker: WRONG THINGS, RIGHT THINGS...
dialogues.text: CINDERELLA

dialogues.speaker: WHO KNOWS WHAT SHE'D SAY
dialogues.text: BAKER

dialogues.speaker: WHO CAN SAY WHAT'S TRUE
dialogues.text: CINDERELLA

dialogues.speaker: NOTHING'S QUITE SO CLEAR NOW.
dialogues.text: BAKER

dialogues.speaker: DO THINGS, FIGHT THINGS...
dialogues.text: CINDERELLA

dialogues.speaker: FEEL YOU'VE LOST YOUR WAY
dialogues.text: BAKER

dialogues.speaker: YOU DECIDE,/ BUT YOU ARE NOT ALONE.
dialogues.text: CINDERELLA

dialogues.speaker: ONE IS ALONE.
dialogues.text: BAKER

dialogues.speaker: NO ONE IS ALONE,/ BELIEVE ME.
dialogues.text: CINDERELLA

dialogues.speaker: TRULY...
dialogues.text: CINDERELLA/BAKER

dialogues.speaker: PEOPLE MAKE MISTAKES.
dialogues.text: BAKER

dialogues.speaker: FATHERS,
dialogues.text: CINDERELLA

dialogues.speaker: MOTHERS,
dialogues.text: CINDERELLA/BAKER

dialogues.speaker: THEIR OWN,/ THINKING THEY'RE ALONE.
dialogues.text: 104  CINDERELLA

dialogues.speaker: HONOR THEIR MISTAKES.
dialogues.text: BAKER

dialogues.speaker: FIGHT FOR THEIR MISTAKES--
dialogues.text: CINDERELLA EVERYBODY MAKES-- CINDERELLA/BAKER

dialogues.speaker: DECIDE WHAT'S GOOD.
dialogues.text: CINDERELLA JUST REMEMBER: BAKER JUST REMEMBER: CINDERELLA/BAKER

dialogues.speaker: SOMEONE IS ON YOUR SIDE.
dialogues.text: LRRH/JACK

dialogues.speaker: OUR SIDE.
dialogues.text: CINDERELLA/BAKER

dialogues.speaker: WE'RE SEEING OUR SIDE--
dialogues.text: LRRH/JACK OUR SIDE-- CINDERELLA/BAKER OUR SIDE-- ALL FOUR

dialogues.speaker: SOMEONE IS ON YOUR SIDE--/ NO ONE IS
dialogues.text: ALONE--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're interrupted by the ominous sounds of the approach GIANT. LRRH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here she comes! ANGLE ON JACK AND THE BAKER. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go, Jack! Be careful.

dialogues.speaker: THE GIANT'S FEET
dialogues.text: Destroying everything in its path. ANGLE ON JACK, as he scurries up higher in the tree. 105  WIDE SHOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GIANT approaches LRRH and CINDERELLA. GIANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is the boy? LRRH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have him. GIANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where? LRRH (POINTS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's hiding in that tree! JACK pops up and reveals himself at the top of the tree. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here I am! The GIANT begins to move aggressively towards JACK. JACK and the BAKER load their slings. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling up to JACK) Ready? JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready! ANGLE on the GIANT'S feet, trampling everything in her pa Suddenly, she steps into the expanse of the tar pit, whic slowly stops her in her tracks. She fights to free hersel she begins to sink.

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: -- The BIRDS fly from the trees. -- BAKER'S POV through the tree branches as the BIRDS swa around the head of the GIANT. -- CINDERELLA and LRRH watch and hear the GIANT'S screams CINDERELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good birds! LRRH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't look happy. -- the BAKER and JACK use their slings to fire stones at GIANT. -- JACK shimmies to the end of a high limb for better aim -- The GIANT reaches blindly towards JACK. 106  LRRH (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look out Jack! -- The GIANT seizes hold of the branch where JACK is stan which knocks JACK off. JACK catches himself on the way do grabbing the branch, and hangs on for dear life. Using on hand, JACK whirls his sling and delivers a knock-out blow the GIANT'S forehead. -- The GIANT reacts and begins to sway. BAKER'S POV of the GIANT'S eye as she fall towards him. The GIANT'S hand grabs some tree branches, as she fights her balance. We hear the crackling branches as the GIANT FALLS pulling the tree down with her, snapping it in a fi deafening THUD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CINDERELLA and LRRH run around the gigantic, exposed root CINDERELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are they? LRRH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack? Mr. Baker? CINDERELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack? JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over here! LRRH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack! LRRH (CONT'D) (TO LRRH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you take him. LRRH takes the BABY as CINDERELLA helps JACK out of the t roots. CINDERELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, be careful, are you alright? JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he? CINDERELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not with you? LRRH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Baker? All three feverishly look for him. 107  BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, Jack! JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me. Help me! BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, I'm here. CINDERELLA helps JACK lift the tree branch as the BAKER, breathless, crawls out from beneath its grasp. He is scratched up, but relieved. CINDERELLA takes the BABY fro LRRH. CINDERELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me take him. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Jack then LRRH) Are you okay? Are you alright? We did it! We did it! Come here. They embrace the BAKER. There's a moment of realization o what just happened as they look up at the roots of the fa tree.  BAKER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we can all return home. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What home? I have no one to take care of me. LRRH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the BAKER) And we have nowhere to go, so we'll move in with you. BAKER WELL --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hesitates then: BAKER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- of course you can come home with me. JACK (TO CINDERELLA)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you can come, too. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you want to. CINDERELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll gladly help you with your house. There are times when I actually enjoy cleaning. 108

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BABY begins to whimper. The BAKER walks towards CINDERELLA and his SON. BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here -- give him to me. The BAKER walks away from the group, trying to settle his SON. He wraps his SCARF around the BABY. BAKER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the BABY) Hey, hey, hey, come on now. Hey, please, come on, come on, it's okay. I know you miss your mother. The BAKER sits on a fallen tree trunk. BAKER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss her too. The BABY cries. BAKER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sssh! The BABY still cries. BAKER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: MAYBE I JUST WASN'T MEANT TO HAVE
dialogues.text: CHILDREN--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BAKER hears his WIFE'S voice. We see her over his shoulder. WIFE

dialogues.speaker: MEANT TO HAVE CHILDREN.
dialogues.text: BAKER

dialogues.speaker: WHEN I HAD NO FATHER TO SHOW ME
dialogues.text: WIFE

dialogues.speaker: JUST CALM THE CHILD.
dialogues.text: BAKER

dialogues.speaker: YES, CALM THE CHILD.
dialogues.text: WIFE

dialogues.speaker: YOU'LL KNOW WHAT TO DO.
dialogues.text: BAKER

dialogues.speaker: ALONE...
dialogues.text: 109  WIFE

dialogues.speaker: RIGHT NOW./ TELL HIM WHAT YOU KNOW...
dialogues.text: BAKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhhh. As the Baker holds his son close, the baby begins to calm down for the first time in his father's arms and his WIFE disappears. The BAKER tells the story to his son -- THE SAME STORY AS HEARD AT THE BEGINNING.

dialogues.speaker: BAKER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Once upon a time...in a far CAREFUL THE THINGS YOU SAY,/ off kingdom...there lay a CHILDREN WILL LISTEN./ small village at the edge of CAREFUL THE THINGS YOU DO,/ the woods... And in this CHILDREN WILL SEE./ AND village lived a young LEARN. maiden...a carefree young lad...and a childless baker...with his wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LRRH, JACK, and CINDERELLA join the BAKER.

dialogues.speaker: WITCH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: BAKER

dialogues.speaker: GUIDE THEM ALONG THE WAY,/
dialogues.text: And one day, the baker and

dialogues.speaker: CHILDREN WILL GLISTEN./
dialogues.text: his wife were in their shop

dialogues.speaker: CHILDREN WILL LOOK TO YOU/
dialogues.text: when a witch burst in,

dialogues.speaker: FOR WHICH WAY TO TURN,/ TO
dialogues.text: blowing the door off its LEARN WHAT TO BE. hinges...

dialogues.speaker: ME."/ CHILDREN WILL LISTEN.
dialogues.text: The light of the new dawn streams down on them, framing t newly formed family. As the BAKER continues to tell the s the CAMERA SLOWLY PULLS UP overhead to reveal the vast wo now changed by the Giant's path. The CAMERA then carries us back beyond the woods and to t Village where we see the destruction that has visited it. WITCH & ALL (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA finally pans up from the Village to the sky an are returned to where we began: the grey clouds of an ear morning sky.

dialogues.speaker: FADE TO BLACK
dialogues.text: THE END
